name: Kepler-304
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-304 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-304 is a star with 0.585 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.69 times its radius. It is located 1435.48 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-304 is known to have 4 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-304 b

Kepler-304 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 3.30 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-304.

The mass of Kepler-304 b is 11.96 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-304 b is 2.86 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-304 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-304 c

Kepler-304 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.32 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-304.

The mass of Kepler-304 c is 6.21 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-304 c is 2.17 that of Earth. At 6.21 Earth masses, Kepler-304 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-304 d

Kepler-304 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 9.65 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-304.

The mass of Kepler-304 d is 10.87 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-304 d is 2.75 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-304 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-304, which contains 4 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
